Title: Prove that any real number can be expressed as the sum of two irrational numbers
Content: Prove that any real number $r$ can be expressed as the sum of two irrational numbers $x$ and $y$. Progress: I have a specific example for any rational number $r$: $x = r-\pi$ and $y = \pi$ (or replace $\pi$ with any irrational number.) However, I can't seem to find a way to prove this in general for irrational $r$. Any help is greatly appreciated.
AcceptedAnswer: If $r$ is irrational, then $r=\frac{r}2+\frac{r}2$. To tell the truth, for $r$ rational we also have $r=\frac{r}2+\frac{r}2$, but it is not useful in this case. :-)
